intro: Acosta transiens, commonly known as the transiting acosta, is a rare flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright, slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Acosta transiens thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
